page.title: 09South Darley Riding Stables
page.content: There are eight horses kept inside.They are Dolly is 12 and gray Raina is 9 and gray. Roody is 5 and gray. Jasper is 10 and brown.Sam is 12 and bay.Florance is 16 and chestnut. Spot is 8 and gray. Dot is 9 and gray. In the tack room there are saddles, bridles, headcollars and hats. They still use side saddles. They have 5. You get the horses from a horse sale or from the adverts in the paper. They take the horses on treks. The riding stables were opened in 1946. The horses are used for riding, driving and side sadle. The number of carriages is about 24. Georgie the owners daughter has been training horses for 5 years. 5 people work at the riding stables. The daily work of a stable girl is to water them, feed them, groom them, muck them out, sweep the yard, ride or drive them,
